content.text: both from the margins and from the inside. They knew about rampant racism, and they were deeply optimistic that they would be able to overcome such barriers. They were fully aware that race/ethnicity makes a difference, but they did not want it to make a difference. They resisted the values of mainstream culture while accepting them wholeheartedly. Irrespective of these tensions, however, the teens repeatedly suggested that they are continually creating strategies to cope as effectively as they can with the very real challenges they confront.
